sentence.Network_en: Experimenters have succeeded in controlling the rate and regularity of the heartbeat.
sentence.Network_cn: 实验者已经成功控制了心跳的速度和频率。

sentence.Network_en: This is an ineffective method of controlling your dog.
sentence.Network_cn: 用这种方法控制你的狗不起作用。

sentence.Network_en: They believed that controlling the money supply would reduce inflation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们相信控制货币供应量会减少通货膨胀。

entry.tran: (对机构、地方、体系等的)控制权，支配权
entry.def: Control of an organization, place, or system is the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: The restructuring involves Mr Ronson giving up control of the company...
example.tran: 这次改组涉及龙森先生放弃对公司的控制权。

example.ex: The first aim of his government would be to establish control over the republic's territory.
example.tran: 他这届政府的首要目标是确立对共和国领土的控制权。

entry.def: If you have control of something or someone, you are able to make them do what you want them to do.

example.ex: He lost control of his car...
example.tran: 他的汽车失控了。

example.ex: Some teachers have more control over pupils than their parents have.
example.tran: 有的老师比小学生的父母更能管得住他们。

entry.def: If you show control, you prevent yourself behaving in an angry or emotional way.

example.ex: He had a terrible temper, and sometimes he would completely lose control...
example.tran: 他的脾气很坏，有时会完全失控。

example.ex: He was working hard to keep control of himself.
example.tran: 他正努力克制自己。

entry.def: The people who control an organization or place have the power to take all the important decisions about the way that it is run.

example.ex: He now controls the largest retail development empire in southern California...
example.tran: 他现在掌管着加州南部最大的零售发展企业。

example.ex: Almost all of the countries in Latin America were controlled by dictators...
example.tran: 当时几乎所有的拉丁美洲国家都由独裁者统治。

entry.tran: 控制，操纵(设备、过程、系统等)
entry.def: To control a piece of equipment, process, or system means to make it work in the way that you want it to work.

example.ex: ...a computerised system to control the gates...
example.tran: 控制大门的计算机系统

example.ex: Scientists would soon be able to manipulate human genes to control the ageing process.
example.tran: 科学家们很快将能通过操控人类基因来控制衰老过程。

entry.tran: 管制，限定，控制(价格、工资、活动等)
entry.def: When a government controls prices, wages, or the activity of a particular group, it uses its power to restrict them.

example.ex: The federal government tried to control rising health-care costs.
example.tran: 联邦政府试图控制日益高涨的医疗保健费用。

example.ex: ...measures to control illegal mining.
example.tran: 控制非法采矿的措施

entry.def: If you control yourself, or if you control your feelings, voice, or expression, you make yourself behave calmly even though you are feeling angry, excited, or upset.

example.ex: Jo was advised to learn to control herself...
example.tran: 乔得到的建议是要学会控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: I just couldn't control my temper.
example.tran: 我就是不能克制自己的脾气。

entry.def: To control something dangerous means to prevent it from becoming worse or from spreading.

example.ex: ...the need to control environmental pollution...
example.tran: 控制环境污染的需要

example.ex: One of the biggest tasks will be to control the spread of malaria.
example.tran: 最大的任务之一就是控制疟疾的蔓延。

entry.tran: 控制按钮;控制装置;操纵装置
entry.def: A control is a device such as a switch or lever which you use in order to operate a machine or other piece of equipment.

example.ex: I practised operating the controls.
example.tran: 我练习操作这些控制装置。

example.ex: ...the control box.
example.tran: 控制盒

entry.def: Controls are the methods that a government uses to restrict increases, for example in prices, wages, or weapons.

example.ex: Critics question whether price controls would do any good...
example.tran: 评论家们质疑物价管制措施是否会有用。

example.ex: Their talks are expected to focus on arms control...
example.tran: 他们的会谈预计会集中讨论军备控制问题。

entry.def: Control is used to refer to a place where your documents or luggage are officially checked when you enter a foreign country.

example.ex: He went straight through Passport Control without incident.
example.tran: 他很顺利地通过了护照检查处。

example.ex: ...an agreement to abolish border controls.
example.tran: 关于取消边界检查站的一项协议

entry.def: If something is out of control, no-one has any power over it.

example.ex: The fire is burning out of control...
example.tran: 熊熊燃烧的大火正在失去控制。

example.ex: I'm dealing with customers all the time who have let their debts get out of control.
example.tran: 我成天和那些负债累累、无力偿还的顾客们打交道。

entry.def: If something harmful is under control, it is being dealt with successfully and is unlikely to cause any more harm.

example.ex: The situation is under control...
example.tran: 局势已经得到控制。

example.ex: If the current violence is to be brought under control, the government needs to act.
example.tran: 政府必须采取行动，才能使目前的暴力行为得到控制。

means.word_mean: 1. able to control or determine policy;

auth_sentence.content: They also learn that controlling their emotions is critical.
auth_sentence.res_content: They also learn that controlling their emotions is critical.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They also learn that controlling their emotions is critical.

auth_sentence.content: They put up temporary one-way signs, controlling junctions.
auth_sentence.res_content: They put up temporary one-way signs, controlling junctions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They put up temporary one-way signs, controlling junctions.

auth_sentence.content: Controlling history is a way of monopolising the truth.
auth_sentence.res_content: Controlling history is a way of monopolising the truth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Controlling history is a way of monopolising the truth.
